help.title: Help
help.description: Displays the help message with available commands.
help.details: Get details on a specific command by running `help <command>`.

config.title: Configuration
config.details:
You can set configuration values by sending `config <key> <value>`, for example, `config prefix ly:`. 
To view all values for a certain key, run `config <key>`. Some keys can have subsets of keys, and running that will show the values of those subsets. For example, `config log` will show the values of all logging-related settings.
For example, to edit the logging channel for moderation actions, you can run `config log/moderation/channel <channel_id>`.

ban.title: Ban
ban.description: Bans a user from the server.
ban.details: You can set a duration, after which the user will be unbanned. The reason should be provided for clarity. Requires the 'Ban Members' permission.

unban.title: Unban
unban.description: Unbans a user from the server.

kick.title: Kick
kick.description: Kicks a user from the server.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Puts a user in timeout for a specified duration.

warn.title: Warn
warn.description: Issues a warning to a user.
warn.details: A reason is required. Requires the 'Manage Messages' permission.

note.title: Note
note.description: Adds a note to a user's profile.
note.details: Requires the 'Manage Server' permission. For global notes, you need to authenticate.

wiki.title: Wiki
wiki.details: Returns an entry in the wiki. By default, sensitive information will be hidden. You can show sensitive information by adding 'sensitive' to the command.

translate.title: Translate
translate.description: Translates text from one language to another.
translate.details: The text is required to be in quotes. The languages are going to be in two letter codes, for example EN for English, or JA for Japanese.

autoresponder.title: Auto Responder
autoresponder.description: Manages automatic responses to specific messages.
autoresponder.details:
Names and triggers must be unique. The trigger and response must be in quotes, for clarity. For example: `ar create greeting "Hello!" "Hi!"`.
You can also specify what language the response is in. You can translate your autoresponder by using `ar edit <name> <response> <lang>`.
Autoresponders can use placeholders and actions. For example, you can use `{user}` to mention the triggering user. You can also use `{react::emoji:}` to add a reaction to the triggering message. To get a list of available placeholders, you can run `help placeholders`

info.title: Info
info.details: If you have the 'Ban Members' permission, you can see infractions on the user, like warns, and notes.

placeholders.title: Placeholders
placeholders.details:
`{user}`: Mentions the user who triggered the command.
`{user_name}`: The username of the user.
`{user_id}`: The ID of the user.
`{mention_name}`: The name of the user mentioned.
`{mention_id}`: The ID of the user mentioned.
`{mention_join_date}`: The join date of the mentioned user.
`{creator_name}`: The name of the creator of the command.
`{creator_id}`: The ID of the creator of the command.
`{server_name}`: The name of the server.
`{server_id}`: The ID of the server.
`{channel}`: The channel where the command was triggered.
`{channel_name}`: The name of the channel.
`{react::emoji:}`: Adds a reaction to the triggering message with the specified emoji.
`{time}`: Current time.
`{date}`: Current date.
`{mention}`: The user who was mentioned in the command.
`{join_date}`: Join date of the user.
`{top_role}`: Top role of the user.
`{creation_date}`: Creation date of a user.
`{server_creation_date}`: Creation date of the server.
`{member_count}`: Count of members in the server.
`{member_count_ordinal}`: Gets the ordinal member count.
You can use these placeholders in various commands to personalize messages and responses.
